text: [Music]
[Music]
hello I'm Kiran a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Dallas today
I'm going to show you how to add or
modify extra connection attributes for
an AWS DMS endpoint extra connection
attributes define the additional
endpoint specific settings for AWS DMS
to add or modify extra connection
attributes for your AWS DMS endpoint you
can use the AWS DMS console or the AWS
command-line interface let's get started
after logging into the AWS management
console navigate to the AWS DMS console
choose the AWS region that you want to
create the endpoint then select the
endpoints from the navigation pane
choose create endpoint choose the
endpoint type and enter the endpoint
configuration details now expand the
endpoint specific settings section in
the extra connection attributes field
enter the name of the extra connection
attribute if you want to add multiple
extra connection attributes enter the
name and value of each attribute
separated with the semicolon and no
spaces optionally if you want to add
encryption choose an AWS key management
service master key now to test the
connection expand the test endpoint
connection section choose your V PC and
application instance click on run test
after the test is successful choose
create endpoint an endpoint is now
created with extra connection attributes
let's now see how to add extra
connection attributes to an existing
endpoint using the AWS DMS console
choose endpoints from the navigation
pane and select the endpoint that you
want to modify choose actions and then
choose smart modify expand the endpoint
specific settings section and enter the
extra connection attributes click on
save from the endpoints pin
select the endpoint again click on
actions and then choose test connection
select a replication instance and choose
run test you can see that the test
connection is now successful
alternatively you can use the AWS
command-line interface to create the new
endpoint and add extra connection
attributes using the following command
you can find the commands in the
knowledge center article with this video
I am going to paste the create endpoint
command now after you create the new
endpoint with the extra connection
attribute you can test the endpoint
connectivity using the following command
now I am going to paste the test
connection command additionally you can
use a deploy as command line interface
to add extra connection attributes to
the existing endpoints with the
following command now I am pasting the
modified endpoint command after you
modify the endpoint to use the extra
connection attribute you can use the
following command to test ik an activity
I'm going to paste the test connection
command back in the DMS console you can
see that the test connection is
successful thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
you
[Music]
